definition: Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石

sentences.english: The second chapter probes into the governmental educational salvage system.
sentences.chinese: 第二章探討國民政府的戰時教育救助體制。

sentences.english: Therefore they are greatly stressed in every dynasty including Nanjing Kuomingtang Government.
sentences.chinese: 南京國民政府成立後，對於縣政也是非常的重視。

sentences.english: The national government of Nanjing implements the separation of the five branches system.
sentences.chinese: 南京國民政府實行五權分立的五院體制。

sentences.english: Beiyang government and Manjing government are corrupt.
sentences.chinese: 北洋軍閥政府及南京國民政府政治腐敗。

sentences.english: Ten years before the anti—Japanese war saw the formation of National government's policy on Tibet.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰前十年是國民政府對藏政策的形成時期。

sentences.english: Her family was quite well-off, and the husband of her eldest sister was the county's governor of the then Republican Government.
sentences.chinese: 家境好，大姐夫又是這個城市裏國民政府的一縣之長。

sentences.english: The aim of the article is to expose the nature of basic level parliaments.
sentences.chinese: 其目的在於揭示國民政府基層民意機關的本質和特性。

sentences.english: The take-over played an important part in the work of the postwar National Government.

sentences.english: Deng Yanda was a central political figure in Wuhan national government.

sentences.english: The government even turned a deaf ear to the direct intervention by the ILO.

sentences.english: The establishment of the Nationalist government in 1928 was supposed tobring the period of warfare to an end.

sentences.english: The reactionary Nanking Kuomintang government deprives the people of all their freedoms and rights;
sentences.chinese: 南京國民政府建立後，黨治政體在全國正式施行。

sentences.english: Firstly, analysis the Nanjing government's modernization and Japan.

sentences.english: At the beginning the National Government practiced a policy of breaking off relations with the Japanese invaders.

sentences.english: There was no fully functional national government in Somalia for more than a decade.
sentences.chinese: 十多年來，索馬里一直沒有一個全功能的國民政府。

definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek
